Articles.Content:
Sorry, no pics for now. I am trying to build a space station. First, I launched a probe with the six-point connector. I put docking ports on the remaining five points, making sure they faced the correct way. On the side opposite of the probe core, I attached the second stage of the rocket to the port. A'ter l launched it to 100Km, I went and designed a solar panel array. After finally succeeding to get the array next to the core, I tried to dock. I right clicked the target port and set it as the target and right clicked the solar panel array's port and selected "control from here." And that's where things go wrong.

When I touch the target port with my port, I get no magnetic effect. I don't think I could get any slower than I did to make contact. I didn't even know I made contact until the core started to rotate. I loaded the quicksave and tried to hit the port harder, but I only pushed the core away. I have tried one final time without success and almost used the solar array to deorbit the core (I reloaded the quicksave and ended the flight afterwards).

I have checked the persistence.sfs file and all ports seem okay. Which leads me to ask if you can dock two ships if one has zero electricity. I launched the core with every intention of it's batteries dying while up there. If I can still dock with no power on the core, why aren't I able to now? As I said, the ports are facing the correct way. Also, SAS is off.

Edited January 11, 2014 by deltalambdamu
Changed Prefix
Were they Srs or the normal clampotrons? Also pics when you can will greatly help any troubleshooting.
Ports need to be the same size. You can try to use mechjeb, its docking autopilot is freaking awesome.

I have zero idea what I did differently this time, but it magically worked. I was able to supply power to the dead probe after extending the solar panels, though I suspect that electric started flowing from the batteries on the panels before I extended them. Also, they are normal docking ports.

Me doing the best approach I can as the quick save put me at ~5m and closing.

Closing in.

And it's current state.

The angle you are coming in at seems a little extreme. Try controlling your ship from the Docking port and setting the other as your target and coming straight on. Navyfish's Docking port alignment indicator is a very useful mod.

The angle you are coming in at seems a little extreme.

Yeah.

Try controlling your ship from the Docking port and setting the other as your target and coming straight on.

I hit "control from here" on the ship's dock port, but nothing at all happened. It's as if I'm a terrible pilot the game isn't supposed to give me that option, or the button isn't linked to a script.

Navyfish's Docking port alignment indicator is a very useful mod.

I will check this out.
Control from here just reorients the navball to reflect whatever docking port/control source you select. If its already pointing that way, you won't see a change.

FIX: ->    F5 and then hold down F9(quicksave, quickload)

Sorry for necroing this year old thread, but I feel that new players need to know/find this before they get frustrated
I got this on medium docking ports, v1.0.5 1028.


So I sent a 110ton spaceplane to orbit with a 2.5m payload(connected with medium docking ports, onto its HubMax cube)
Once at the station, I connect it and realize I could do something useful while the spaceplane is up there...like bringing down my crippled Duna lander(for the "craft landed on Duna science bonus")
As I try to dock it, I find that it could "balance" and "stand" still on the plane's docking port while the plane is accelerating with RCS...did not get the slightest magnetic pull, and undocked it from the interplanetary ship like 5 minutes ago
